Protected Attributes

  • TImage m_Image
    The structure from the C kernel, holding all information about the image.

Detailed Description

CStdImage is an abstract base class derived from CGenericImage from which all photo related image classes are derived, last updated 1/30/2002.

At the moment two derived classes exists: CImage and CByteImage.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CGenericImage
Version:
1.51, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

bool ipl::CStdImage::Add (  CStdImage &    Addend ) 
 

calculates the sum of two CStdImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Addend  is the image of class CStdImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or image depth is not 8 b/p

Definition at line 455 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

virtual bool ipl::CStdImage::Alloc (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
UINT16    Bits,
UINT32    Color
)  [pure virtual]
 

Allocates memory for image with given size and pixel depth.

All pixel values are initialised to 0.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels
Height  The height of image in pixels
Bits  Number of bits per pixel, 1, 4, 8 or 24. Note: If the instance of this object is a CByteImage an error will be generated if "Bits" is not 8 b/p.
Color  Initial color value in all pixels, for 24 b/p (see Bits parameter) images an RGB value, otherwise a palette index value..
Returns :
False, if allocation failed or in case of CByteImage if "Bits" is not 8 b/p.

Implemented in ipl::CByteImage, and ipl::CImage.

virtual bool ipl::CStdImage::AllocFast (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
UINT16    Bits
)  [pure virtual]
 

Allocates memory for image with given size and pixel depth.

Pixel values are not initialised.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels
Height  The height of image in pixels
Bits  Number of bits per pixel, 1, 4, 8 or 24
Returns :
False, if allocation failed or in case of CByteImage if "Bits" is not 8 b/p.

Implemented in ipl::CByteImage, and ipl::CImage.

Referenced by ipl::CSparseHoughSpace2D::ToImage(), ipl::CHoughSpace2D::ToImage(), and ipl::CBinaryImage::ToImage().

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

bool ipl::CStdImage::Copy (  COMPLEXCHOISE    mode,
CComplexImage &    Source
) 
 

copies partially an image of class CComplex into this object.

Adds new line to history. Note that this is a straight forward convertion, values are truncated directly to the destination range. For more advanced convertions look at the methods available in the class CLocalOperation. History from Source is copied to this image, old history in this image is deleted.

Parameters:
mode  Determines what part of the complex image is to be copied. The values are COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, or COMPLEX_MODULUS.
Source  is the source image.
Returns :
False if the source image is empty.

virtual bool ipl::CStdImage::CopyConvert (  UINT16    Bits,
CStdImage &    SourceImage
)  [pure virtual]
 

Copies a whole image to "this" object and convert the pixel depth, if the new bits per pixel is the same as source image b/p the "="-operator is used.

See inherited classes for details about possible conversions. ROI is inactivated. Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
SourceImage  Image to copy and convert from. The SourceImage is left unchanged.
Bits  Bits per pixel for the new image contained in "this" object.
SourceImage  Image to copy and convert from. The SourceImage is left unchanged.
Returns :
False, if source image is empty or if Bits is not 1, 8 or 24.

Implemented in ipl::CByteImage, and ipl::CImage.

bool ipl::CStdImage::CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy
) 
 

performs a displacement so that (dx,dy).

in the old picture becomes (0,0). Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
Returns :
False if the image is empty or image depth is not 8 b/p

Definition at line 542 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), m_History, m_Image, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CStdImage::CopySubImage (  CStdImage &    SourceImage,
const CPoint2D< int > &    UpperLeft,
const CPoint2D< int > &    LowerRight
) 
 

Copies a CStdImage to this image.

The positions UpperLeft and LowerRight specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). ROI is inactivated. Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
SourceImage  Image to copy a sub area from.
UpperLeft  position in the upper left corner to start from.
LowerRight  position in the lower left corner to stop at.
Returns :
false if outside image

Reimplemented in ipl::CByteImage.

Definition at line 280 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TImage::FileInfo, GetConstTImagePtr(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CStdImage::CopySubImage (  CStdImage &    SourceImage,
int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax
) 
 

Copies a CStdImage to this image.

The positions (xmin,ymin) and (xmax,ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). ROI is inactivated. Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
SourceImage  Image to copy and convert from. The SourceImage is left unchanged.
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
Returns :
false if outside image

Reimplemented in ipl::CByteImage.

Definition at line 245 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetPathAndFileName(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CStdImage::CutOrZeroPad (  CStdImage &    Source ) 
 

copies a source image into 'this' object without scaling.

'This' object must be allocated. If the width/height of the source is larger than that of 'this' object, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Source  is the spource image
Returns :
False if 'this' image and/or the source image are empty

void ipl::CStdImage::Empty (    )  [virtual]
 

Deletes all allocated memory for image and resets variables.

ROI is inactivated, history is cleared.

UINT8 ipl::CStdImage::GetBlueComponent (  const CPoint2D< int > &    Pos )  [inline, virtual]
 

Returns the blue component value at position Pos, including range check.

Slow access. If the image contains a palette this method takes care of finding the color value from the palette index and extracting the blue component. If no palette is present it extracts the blue component directly from the pixel value.

Parameters:
Pos  2-Dimensional position in image.
Returns :
Blue component value

UINT32 ipl::CStdImage::GetColorInterpolated (  const CPoint2D< float > &    Pos )  const [inline, virtual]
 

returns the interpolated color value at position Pos, including range check.

To be used for images with 24 b/p only, produces an error in other cases. Uses bilinar interpolation for each color channel (R, G and B) and rounds of to nearest integer value.

Parameters:
Pos  2-Dimensional position in image.
Returns :
interpolated pixel value

UINT32 ipl::CStdImage::GetColorInterpolatedFast (  const CPoint2D< float > &    Pos )  const [inline, virtual]
 

returns the interpolated color value at position Pos, without range check.

To be used for images with 24 b/p only. Uses bilinar interpolation for each color channel (R, G and B) and rounds of to nearest integer value.

interpolated pixel value

Definition at line 513 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

CStdImage & ipl::CStdImage::operator= (  const CStdImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator.

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette, ROI and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. Source image is left unchanged. Adds new line to history. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Reimplemented in ipl::CByteImage, and ipl::CImage.

Definition at line 32 of file std_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetConstTImagePtr(), ipl::CText::GetItem(), GetOrigin(), TImage::History, m_History, m_Image, m_Pal, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TImage::Pal, TString::pChars, ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine(), ipl::CPalette::SetPalettePtr(), ipl::CText::SetTextPtr(), and ipl::CText::TotalItems().

virtual bool ipl::CStdImage::SetPixel (  const CPoint2D< INT16 > &    Pos,
UINT32    Color
)  [inline, pure virtual]
 

Sets a pixel at position Pos, including range check, slow access.

Parameters:
Pos  2-Dimensional position in image.
Color  The new pixel value, for 24 b/p images an RGB value, otherwise a palette index value.
Returns :
false if outside image or if b/p is not supported.

Implemented in ipl::CByteImage, and ipl::CImage.

int    y,
UINT32    Color
)  [inline, pure virtual]
 

Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

bool ipl::CStdImage::Subtract (  CStdImage &    Subtrahend ) 
 

calculates the difference of two CStdImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Subtrahend  is the image of class CStdImage to be subtracted
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or image depth is not 8 b/p
